entries.meaning: past participle of lie (“to be oriented in a horizontal position, situated”)
examples: He had lain there for many hours.
The book had lain on the attic floor until it was found decades later.

description: From Middle English lainen, leynen, from Old Norse leyna (“to conceal”) and Old English līeġnan (“to deny; conceal”); both from Proto-Germanic *laugnijaną, from Proto-Germanic *laugnō (“secrecy”).

verbs.description: lain (third-person singular simple present lains, present participle laining, simple past and past participle lained)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To conceal, keep quiet about. [14th–19th c.]
